content.raw:
Would it be possible to publish one more topic containing the state of the scoring module, say at 1Hz?  In particular it would be helpful to have access to the following information at all times:

- current task
- time remaining
- checkpoints remaining
- lives remaining (3 - how many times the robot has been damaged in this run)
- uplink bits remaining
- downlink bits remaining

In principle we can keep track of all this ourselves, but if our software crashes and needs to be restarted during a run, this crucial information will be lost.  Furthermore, some of these states we cannot really compute -- for example the acceleration used to determine if the robot is damaged (we only have noisy velocity data).  Currently Gazebo prints a message on the console if the robot is damaged, but we will not be looking at the Field Computer console during the VRC.  Similarly, after all the debates on bit counting, it would be nice to know the state of the official bit counter at all times (and reduce our data transmission if we are about to run out of bits).
